title: South Korea’s Lawmakers Question Military About Yoon’s Martial Law Order
content: The military has spent decades trying to rehabilitate its image and win public trust after a brutal past. Its role in President Yoon’s martial law raised a specter from that era.
summary: The military has spent decades trying to rehabilitate its image and win public trust after a brutal past. Its role in President Yoon’s martial law raised a specter from that era.

title: Gazans With Disabilities Face ‘Impossible Times’ of Chaos and War
content: A family fled carrying a 9-year-old girl for hours on their backs. Sisters with visual impairments pleaded for help as Israeli airstrikes fell. “It’s a nightmare,” one wheelchair user said.
summary: A family fled carrying a 9-year-old girl for hours on their backs. Sisters with visual impairments pleaded for help as Israeli airstrikes fell. “It’s a nightmare,” one wheelchair user said.

title: For Macron, Notre-Dame’s Reopening Offers Respite From Political Crisis
content: The 860-year-old cathedral has been repaired in a time frame many thought impossible. But rather than basking in success, President Emmanuel Macron is mired in political crisis.
summary: The 860-year-old cathedral has been repaired in a time frame many thought impossible. But rather than basking in success, President Emmanuel Macron is mired in political crisis.

title: Brazil’s Most Common Surname Has a Grim Past
content: Silva, the surname of presidents and soccer stars, has long carried stigma over its colonial links. Now, many see its legacy in new ways.
summary: Silva, the surname of presidents and soccer stars, has long carried stigma over its colonial links. Now, many see its legacy in new ways.

title: Syrian Rebels Storm Hama as Government Forces Withdraw
content: Opposition forces advanced on the city of Hama as their startling offensive moved quickly in the direction of the capital, Damascus.
summary: Opposition forces advanced on the city of Hama as their startling offensive moved quickly in the direction of the capital, Damascus.

title: For Opponents Hiding from Venezuelan Government, No Food, Water or Power
content: Six leading opposition activists and advisers have taken refuge at the Argentine diplomatic residence for eight months. Now, the police are cutting off basic services.
summary: Six leading opposition activists and advisers have taken refuge at the Argentine diplomatic residence for eight months. Now, the police are cutting off basic services.

title: Ukraine Makes a Case to Trump’s Team as Its Officials Visit U.S.

title: Roommate Convicted in Murder of Kenyan Gay Rights Activist
content: Edwin Chiloba’s body was found stuffed inside a metal box by the roadside last year. A high court judge did not give a motive but said his roommate carried out the murder.
summary: Edwin Chiloba’s body was found stuffed inside a metal box by the roadside last year. A high court judge did not give a motive but said his roommate carried out the murder.

title: Amnesty International Accuses Israel of Genocide in Gaza
content: Israel rejected the charge — the first of its kind by a major human rights organization — saying it was “based on lies.”
summary: Israel rejected the charge — the first of its kind by a major human rights organization — saying it was “based on lies.”

title: Coming for Selfies, Staying for Art: Dakar’s Biennale Draws Young Crowd
content: Encouraged by Senegal’s new president, teenagers and young adults, with social media tools in hand, have thronged an art exhibition that is usually the exclusive realm of the wealthy and elite.
summary: Encouraged by Senegal’s new president, teenagers and young adults, with social media tools in hand, have thronged an art exhibition that is usually the exclusive realm of the wealthy and elite.

title: Deadly Israeli Strike Hits Gaza Humanitarian Zone
content: The Israeli military said it was targeting senior Hamas militants in the area. Video from the scene showed the charred remains of tents.

title: Where Is Assisted Dying Legal? And What Countries Are Considering It?
content: Assisted dying is legal or partly legal in about a dozen countries, and more are considering allowing it.

title: China Slaps Sanctions on 13 U.S. Defense Firms
content: The largely symbolic move is in response to the Biden administration’s latest arms sales to Taiwan, the island democracy that China considers its own.

title: South Korea’s Defense Minister Steps Down Over Martial Law Decree

title: Prince Johnson, Warlord Who Executed Liberia’s President, Dies at 72
content: A rebel leader in Liberia’s civil wars, he was accused of numerous atrocities. The most notorious was the videotaped mutilation and killing of President Samuel Doe.
summary: A rebel leader in Liberia’s civil wars, he was accused of numerous atrocities. The most notorious was the videotaped mutilation and killing of President Samuel Doe.

title: How Global Conflicts Helped Reignite Syria’s Civil War
content: Rebels launched sweeping assaults against the forces of President Bashar al-Assad in northwestern Syria, taking control of large portions of territory, including much of the city of Aleppo. Carlotta Gall, a senior correspondent for The New York Times, explains how events beyond Syria’s borders lit the fuse for renewed fighting.
summary: Rebels launched sweeping assaults against the forces of President Bashar al-Assad in northwestern Syria, taking control of large portions of territory, including much of the city of Aleppo. Carlotta Gall, a senior correspondent for The New York Times, explains how events beyond Syria’s borders lit the fuse for renewed fighting.

title: American Kidnapped in Philippines Is Believed to Be Dead, Police Say
content: The police said they believed Elliot Eastman, 26, from Vermont, was killed during the abduction in October. They cited testimony from a suspect in custody.
summary: The police said they believed Elliot Eastman, 26, from Vermont, was killed during the abduction in October. They cited testimony from a suspect in custody.

title: U.S. Defends Paris Climate Accord as ‘Best Hope’ at International Court of Justice

title: Israel’s Military Says Hostages Were Likely Killed by Hamas as Airstrike Hit

title: South Korean Lawmakers Move to Impeach President Yoon After Failed Martial Law Bid
content: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s attempt to break a political deadlock by imposing military rule collapsed within hours, leaving him with few defenders. A vote to impeach him could come as soon as Friday.
summary: President Yoon Suk Yeol’s attempt to break a political deadlock by imposing military rule collapsed within hours, leaving him with few defenders. A vote to impeach him could come as soon as Friday.

title: Zelensky Offers $24 One-Off Payment to Win Over War-Weary Ukrainians
content: Citizens will be entitled to a $24 one-off payment this winter, President Volodymyr Zelensky announced, in a move apparently intended to soften the blow of a tax rise to help fund the war effort.
summary: Citizens will be entitled to a $24 one-off payment this winter, President Volodymyr Zelensky announced, in a move apparently intended to soften the blow of a tax rise to help fund the war effort.

title: Tapped by Trudeau to Steer Foreign Affairs, She’s Now His Possible Successor

title: Timeline: How Yoon’s Presidency in South Korea Led to Martial Law Order

title: Martial Law in South Korea Tests Biden and a Key U.S. Alliance
